intro: Rourea pseudogardneriana, commonly known as the mountain rourea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid or semi-arid regions.
